alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Municipality of Skagway; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 3:55PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW AND SIGNIFICANT COOL DOWN AHEAD... In the wake of the most recent system, cooler weather will begin moving into the area through Friday, setting the stage for accumulating snow across much of the panhandle Friday afternoon into Saturday as a frontal band moves into the panhandle, followed by chances for additional snow on Saturday as the main low pressure system moves off the SE. Anticipate that the heaviest snowfall rates will be from Friday evening through early Saturday morning, and primarily focused across the N half of the panhandle including the Icy Strait Corridor, as well as Hyder. The cool down will continue through the remainder of the weekend and the majority of the next week. Another system may bring accumulating snow to the Southern panhandle next Monday and Tuesday, but the storm track is still uncertain.
